trans-unit.source: Install and use Giraph on Hadoop clusters in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Install and use Giraph on Hadoop clusters in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to customize HDInsight cluster with Giraph.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to customize HDInsight cluster with Giraph.

trans-unit.source: You'll use a Script Action configuration option to use a script to install Giraph.
trans-unit.target: You'll use a Script Action configuration option to use a script to install Giraph.

trans-unit.source: Install Giraph on HDInsight Hadoop clusters, and use Giraph to process large-scale graphs
trans-unit.target: Install Giraph on HDInsight Hadoop clusters, and use Giraph to process large-scale graphs

trans-unit.source: You can install Giraph on any type of cluster in Hadoop on Azure HDInsight by using **Script Action** cluster customization.
trans-unit.target: You can install Giraph on any type of cluster in Hadoop on Azure HDInsight by using **Script Action** cluster customization.

trans-unit.source: Script Action lets you run scripts to customize a cluster, only when the cluster is being created.
trans-unit.target: Script Action lets you run scripts to customize a cluster, only when the cluster is being created.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: In this topic, you will learn how to install Giraph by using Script Action.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, you will learn how to install Giraph by using Script Action.

trans-unit.source: Once you have installed Giraph, you'll also learn how to use Giraph for most typical applications, which is to process large-scale graphs.
trans-unit.target: Once you have installed Giraph, you'll also learn how to use Giraph for most typical applications, which is to process large-scale graphs.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The information in this article is specific to Linux-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The information in this article is specific to Linux-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: For information on working with Windows-based clusters, see [Install Giraph on HDInsight Hadoop clusters (Windows)](hdinsight-hadoop-giraph-install.md)
trans-unit.target: For information on working with Windows-based clusters, see [Install Giraph on HDInsight Hadoop clusters (Windows)](hdinsight-hadoop-giraph-install.md)

trans-unit.source: What is Giraph?
trans-unit.target: What is Giraph?

trans-unit.source: [Apache Giraph](http://giraph.apache.org/) allows you to perform graph processing by using Hadoop, and can be used with Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: [Apache Giraph](http://giraph.apache.org/) allows you to perform graph processing by using Hadoop, and can be used with Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Graphs model relationships between objects, such as the connections between routers on a large network like the Internet, or relationships between people on social networks (sometimes referred to as a social graph).
trans-unit.target: Graphs model relationships between objects, such as the connections between routers on a large network like the Internet, or relationships between people on social networks (sometimes referred to as a social graph).

trans-unit.source: Graph processing allows you to reason about the relationships between objects in a graph, such as:
trans-unit.target: Graph processing allows you to reason about the relationships between objects in a graph, such as:

trans-unit.source: Identifying potential friends based on your current relationships.
trans-unit.target: Identifying potential friends based on your current relationships.

trans-unit.source: Identifying the shortest route between two computers in a network.
trans-unit.target: Identifying the shortest route between two computers in a network.

trans-unit.source: Calculating the page rank of webpages.
trans-unit.target: Calculating the page rank of webpages.

trans-unit.source: What the script does
trans-unit.target: What the script does

trans-unit.source: This script performs the following actions:
trans-unit.target: This script performs the following actions:

trans-unit.source: Installs Giraph to `/usr/hdp/current/giraph`
trans-unit.target: Installs Giraph to `/usr/hdp/current/giraph`

trans-unit.source: Copies the `giraph-examples.jar` file to default storage (WASB) for your cluster: `/example/jars/giraph-examples.jar`
trans-unit.target: Copies the `giraph-examples.jar` file to default storage (WASB) for your cluster: `/example/jars/giraph-examples.jar`

trans-unit.source: Install Giraph using Script Actions
trans-unit.target: Install Giraph using Script Actions

trans-unit.source: A sample script to install Giraph on an HDInsight cluster is available from a read-only Azure storage blob at [https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxgiraphconfigactionv01/giraph-installer-v01.sh](https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxgiraphconfigactionv01/giraph-installer-v01.sh).
trans-unit.target: A sample script to install Giraph on an HDInsight cluster is available from a read-only Azure storage blob at [https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxgiraphconfigactionv01/giraph-installer-v01.sh](https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxgiraphconfigactionv01/giraph-installer-v01.sh).

trans-unit.source: This section provides instructions on how to use the sample script while provisioning the cluster by using the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This section provides instructions on how to use the sample script while provisioning the cluster by using the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can also use Azure PowerShell or the HDInsight .NET SDK to create a cluster using this script.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can also use Azure PowerShell or the HDInsight .NET SDK to create a cluster using this script.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using these methods, see [Customize HDInsight clusters with Script Actions](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using these methods, see [Customize HDInsight clusters with Script Actions](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: Start provisioning a cluster by using the steps in [Provision Linux-based HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-provision-linux-clusters.md#portal), but do not complete provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Start provisioning a cluster by using the steps in [Provision Linux-based HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-provision-linux-clusters.md#portal), but do not complete provisioning.

trans-unit.source: On the **Optional Configuration** blade, select **Script Actions**, and provide the information below:
trans-unit.target: On the **Optional Configuration** blade, select **Script Actions**, and provide the information below:

trans-unit.source: __NAME__: Enter a friendly name for the script action.
trans-unit.target: __NAME__: Enter a friendly name for the script action.

trans-unit.source: __SCRIPT URI__: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxgiraphconfigactionv01/giraph-installer-v01.sh
trans-unit.target: __SCRIPT URI__: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxgiraphconfigactionv01/giraph-installer-v01.sh

trans-unit.source: __HEAD__: Check this option
trans-unit.target: __HEAD__: Check this option

trans-unit.source: __WORKER__: Check this option
trans-unit.target: __WORKER__: Check this option

trans-unit.source: __ZOOKEEPER__: Check this option to install on the Zookeeper node.
trans-unit.target: __ZOOKEEPER__: Check this option to install on the Zookeeper node.

trans-unit.source: __PARAMETERS__: Leave this field blank
trans-unit.target: __PARAMETERS__: Leave this field blank

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the **Script Actions**, use the **Select** button to save the configuration.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the **Script Actions**, use the **Select** button to save the configuration.

trans-unit.source: Finally, use the **Select** button at the bottom of the **Optional Configuration** blade to save the optional configuration information.
trans-unit.target: Finally, use the **Select** button at the bottom of the **Optional Configuration** blade to save the optional configuration information.

trans-unit.source: Continue provisioning the cluster as described in [Provision Linux-based HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-provision-linux-clusters.md#portal).
trans-unit.target: Continue provisioning the cluster as described in [Provision Linux-based HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-provision-linux-clusters.md#portal).

trans-unit.source: How do I use Giraph in HDInsight?
trans-unit.target: How do I use Giraph in HDInsight?

trans-unit.source: Once the cluster has finished provisioning, use the following steps to run the SimpleShortestPathsComputation example included with Giraph.
trans-unit.target: Once the cluster has finished provisioning, use the following steps to run the SimpleShortestPathsComputation example included with Giraph.

trans-unit.source: This implements the basic Pregel implementation for finding the shortest path between objects in a graph.
trans-unit.target: This implements the basic Pregel implementation for finding the shortest path between objects in a graph.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the HDInsight cluster using SSH:
trans-unit.target: Connect to the HDInsight cluster using SSH:

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see the following:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see the following:

trans-unit.source: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X
trans-unit.target: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X

trans-unit.source: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows
trans-unit.target: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows

trans-unit.source: Use the following to create a new file named __tiny_graph.txt__:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to create a new file named __tiny_graph.txt__:

trans-unit.source: Use the following as the contents of this file:
trans-unit.target: Use the following as the contents of this file:

trans-unit.source: This data describes a relationship between objects in a directed graph, by using the format [source\_id, source\_value,[[dest\_id], [edge\_value],...]].
trans-unit.target: This data describes a relationship between objects in a directed graph, by using the format [source\_id, source\_value,[[dest\_id], [edge\_value],...]].

trans-unit.source: Each line represents a relationship between a **source\_id** object and one or more **dest\_id** objects.
trans-unit.target: Each line represents a relationship between a **source\_id** object and one or more **dest\_id** objects.

trans-unit.source: The **edge\_value** (or weight) can be thought of as the strength or distance of the connection between **source_id** and **dest\_id**.
trans-unit.target: The **edge\_value** (or weight) can be thought of as the strength or distance of the connection between **source_id** and **dest\_id**.

trans-unit.source: Drawn out, and using the value (or weight) as the distance between objects, the above data might look like this:
trans-unit.target: Drawn out, and using the value (or weight) as the distance between objects, the above data might look like this:

trans-unit.source: tiny_graph.txt drawn as circles with lines of varying distance between
trans-unit.target: tiny_graph.txt drawn as circles with lines of varying distance between

trans-unit.source: To save the file, use __Ctrl+X__, then __Y__, and finally __Enter__ to accept the file name.
trans-unit.target: To save the file, use __Ctrl+X__, then __Y__, and finally __Enter__ to accept the file name.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to store the data into primary storage for your HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to store the data into primary storage for your HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: Run the SimpleShortestPathsComputation example using the following command:
trans-unit.target: Run the SimpleShortestPathsComputation example using the following command:

trans-unit.source: The parameters used with this command are described in the following table.
trans-unit.target: The parameters used with this command are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: What it does
trans-unit.target: What it does

trans-unit.source: The jar file containing the examples.
trans-unit.target: The jar file containing the examples.

trans-unit.source: The class used to start the examples.
trans-unit.target: The class used to start the examples.

trans-unit.source: The example that will be ran.
trans-unit.target: The example that will be ran.

trans-unit.source: In this case, it will compute the shortest path between ID 1 and all other IDs in the graph.
trans-unit.target: In this case, it will compute the shortest path between ID 1 and all other IDs in the graph.

trans-unit.source: The headnode for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The headnode for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The input format to use for the input data.
trans-unit.target: The input format to use for the input data.

trans-unit.source: The input data file.
trans-unit.target: The input data file.

trans-unit.source: The output format.
trans-unit.target: The output format.

trans-unit.source: In this case, ID and value as plain text.
trans-unit.target: In this case, ID and value as plain text.

trans-unit.source: The output location.
trans-unit.target: The output location.

trans-unit.source: The number of workers to use.
trans-unit.target: The number of workers to use.

trans-unit.source: In this case, 2.
trans-unit.target: In this case, 2.

trans-unit.source: For more information on these, and other parameters used with Giraph samples, see the [Giraph quickstart](http://giraph.apache.org/quick_start.html).
trans-unit.target: For more information on these, and other parameters used with Giraph samples, see the [Giraph quickstart](http://giraph.apache.org/quick_start.html).

trans-unit.source: Once the job has finished, the results will be stored in the __wasb:///example/out/shotestpaths__ directory.
trans-unit.target: Once the job has finished, the results will be stored in the __wasb:///example/out/shotestpaths__ directory.

trans-unit.source: The files created will begin with __part-m-__ and end with a number indicating the first, second, etc. file.
trans-unit.target: The files created will begin with __part-m-__ and end with a number indicating the first, second, etc. file.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to view the output:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to view the output:

trans-unit.source: The output should appear similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The output should appear similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: The SimpleShortestPathComputation example is hard coded to start with object ID 1 and find the shortest path to other objects.
trans-unit.target: The SimpleShortestPathComputation example is hard coded to start with object ID 1 and find the shortest path to other objects.

trans-unit.source: So the output should be read as `destination_id distance`, where distance is the value (or weight) of the edges traveled between object ID 1 and the target ID.
trans-unit.target: So the output should be read as `destination_id distance`, where distance is the value (or weight) of the edges traveled between object ID 1 and the target ID.

trans-unit.source: Visualizing this, you can verify the results by traveling the shortest paths between ID 1 and all other objects.
trans-unit.target: Visualizing this, you can verify the results by traveling the shortest paths between ID 1 and all other objects.

trans-unit.source: Note that the shortest path between ID 1 and ID 4 is 5.
trans-unit.target: Note that the shortest path between ID 1 and ID 4 is 5.

trans-unit.source: This is the total distance between ID 1 and 3, and then ID 3 and 4.
trans-unit.target: This is the total distance between ID 1 and 3, and then ID 3 and 4.

trans-unit.source: Drawing of objects as circles with shortest paths drawn between
trans-unit.target: Drawing of objects as circles with shortest paths drawn between

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: [Install and use Hue on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: [Install and use Hue on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-hue-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: Hue is a web UI that makes it easy to create, run and save Pig and Hive jobs, as well as browse the default storage for your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Hue is a web UI that makes it easy to create, run and save Pig and Hive jobs, as well as browse the default storage for your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: [Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-spark-install-linux.md): Instructions on how to use cluster customization to install and use Spark on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: [Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-spark-install-linux.md): Instructions on how to use cluster customization to install and use Spark on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Spark is an open-source parallel processing framework that supports in-memory processing to boost the performance of big-data analytic applications.
trans-unit.target: Spark is an open-source parallel processing framework that supports in-memory processing to boost the performance of big-data analytic applications.

trans-unit.source: [Install R on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-r-scripts-linux.md): Instructions on how to use cluster customization to install and use R on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: [Install R on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-r-scripts-linux.md): Instructions on how to use cluster customization to install and use R on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: R is an open-source language and environment for statistical computing.
trans-unit.target: R is an open-source language and environment for statistical computing.

trans-unit.source: It provides hundreds of built-in statistical functions and its own programming language that combines aspects of functional and object-oriented programming.
trans-unit.target: It provides hundreds of built-in statistical functions and its own programming language that combines aspects of functional and object-oriented programming.

trans-unit.source: It also provides extensive graphical capabilities.
trans-unit.target: It also provides extensive graphical capabilities.

trans-unit.source: [Install Solr on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-solr-install-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: [Install Solr on HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-solr-install-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: Use cluster customization to install Solr on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Use cluster customization to install Solr on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Solr allows you to perform powerful search operations on data stored.
trans-unit.target: Solr allows you to perform powerful search operations on data stored.
